Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Singapore at the 1982 Asian Games" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Sporting event delegation **[Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)** participated in the **[1982 Asian Games](/wiki/1982_Asian_Games)** held in [New Delhi](/wiki/New_Delhi), [India](/wiki/India) from 19 November to 4 December 1982. Singapore ranked 16th with 1 gold and 2 bronze medals with a total of 3 over-all medals. Singapore sent 64 athletes to compete in New Delhi. [National water polo team](/wiki/Singapore_men%27s_national_water_polo_team) coach, [Tan Eng Bock](/wiki/Tan_Eng_Bock), was assigned as [chef de mission](/wiki/Head_of_mission) for the contingent. On the eve of the games, Tan revealed the target of meeting the same number of medals at the [1978 Asian Games](/wiki/1978_Asian_Games), two golds, one bronze and four silver medals. ## Medalists
